title: Your options for making child arrangements
introduction:
Parents may need to agree child arrangements (also known as custody) if they divorce or separate.

For example, they must decide where the children will live and how much time they spend with each parent.

Parents can make arrangements themselves or use an adviser, such as a solicitor or mediator.

Which option parents choose usually depends on how well they can communicate after separation.
